page.title: 13 Dr Samuel Johnson
page.content: In the market square there is a statue of Dr Johnson to commemorate the anniversary of his death in 1784. On one side it has inscribed the words "Every man has a lurking wish to appear considerable in his native place." He was born in Lichfield in 1709 and his birthplace overlooks the market square where his statue stands. In the house, now a museum, there is a collection of objects, clocks, china, paintings and other items of interest, belonging to the time when Dr Johnson lived there. Many books belonging to Dr Johnson are to be found in two libraries within the house.
